author: CMS Medios
title: Pugnar√°n por proteger a los hu√©rfanos del feminicidio en BC | Noticias de Tijuana | EL IMPARCIAL
text: Pugnar√°n por proteger a los hu√©rfanos del feminicidio en BC En los casos en los que las v√≠ctimas de feminicidio tuvieron hijos debi√≥ aplicarse un protocolo de orfandad donde ten√≠a que haber intervenido la Procuradur√≠a de la Defensa del Menor en el Estado. Ensenada, BC.- El problema de los feminicidios en el Estado ha dejado a una gran cantidad de menores desprotegidos que actualmente no reciben ning√∫n apoyo, denunci√≥ Miriam Ay√≥n Castro, integrante de la [Red de Mujeres Unidas por Baja California.](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Ocupa-Baja-California-tercer-lugar-en-muertes-violentas-y-numero-13-en-feminicidios-20230918-0027.html) Record√≥ que en agosto de este a√±o la red en conjunto con la Comisi√≥n Estatal de Derechos Humanos public√≥ un estudio sobre feminicidios, que arroj√≥ que en el estado hay 51 sentencias de feminicidio que est√°n catalogadas por el poder Judicial como sentencias con perspectiva de g√©nero. Te puede interesar: [Apoyan a mujeres v√≠ctimas de violencia vicaria](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Atiende-Colectivo-Cesodi-50-casos-de-mujeres-victimas-de-violencia-vicaria-20231115-0033.html) ‚ÄúAplicando un mecanismo y un protocolo ya establecido por la Suprema Corte de Justicia nos encontramos con que el gran porcentaje de esas sentencias no cumplen con la perspectiva de g√©nero y justamente uno de los indicadores que evaluamos fue la atenci√≥n a las v√≠ctimas y a los hu√©rfanos del feminicidio‚Äù, expuso. Protocolo de orfandad Puntualiz√≥ que en los casos en los que las v√≠ctimas de feminicidio tuvieron hijos debi√≥ aplicarse un protocolo de orfandad donde ten√≠a que haber intervenido la Procuradur√≠a de la Defensa del Menor en el Estado. Hoy en d√≠a no hay una autoridad que nos pueda indicar qu√© ha pasado con los hu√©rfanos del feminicidio, nos percatarnos que no hab√≠a una reparaci√≥n integral del da√±o, la ley establece cu√°les son los elementos que se tienen que considerar para determinar la reparaci√≥n del da√±o y la cuant√≠a en cuanto al monto que el agresor tendr√° que pagar como una indemnizaci√≥n a las v√≠ctimas y encontramos que se hizo todo de machote y solo se le puso el precio a la v√≠ctima sin considerarse las condiciones‚Äù, se√±al√≥. La activista dijo que se debe de considerar si el menor estaba en cierto nivel educativo y ten√≠a ciertas necesidades, si el menor ten√≠a alguna discapacidad o enfermedad que requiriera atenci√≥n especial, las condiciones econ√≥micas de la familia que se hizo cargo del menor, entre otros elementos que se deben contemplar para que el menor tenga una vida digna. Te puede interesar: [Red de mujeres de BC invitan a usar ''lentes violeta'' para equidad y justicia](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Red-de-mujeres-de-BC-invitan-a-usar-lentes-violeta-para-equidad-y-justicia-20231110-0039.html) ‚ÄúSi esa madre era el sustento o la jefa de familia de ese menor y no el padre como hay muchos casos en Baja California, eso tambi√©n tiene que ser determinado al momento de determinar la cuant√≠a de la reparaci√≥n del da√±o, todos estos elementos no se tomaron en cuenta‚Äù, lament√≥. Sentencias Refiri√≥ que en gran parte de los casos el agresor habr√≠a reconocido ser pareja de la v√≠ctima y por lo tanto con base en eso fue catalogado como un feminicidio y por consiguiente fue determinada una sentencia a trav√©s de un procedimiento abreviado. ‚ÄúNo se profundiz√≥ y no se llev√≥ un proceso legal ordinario como debi√≥ haber sido, hablando de un delito tan grave y m√°s donde hay menores involucrados, fueron definidos por un procedimiento abreviado donde el reconocimiento del agresor donde asum√≠a la culpa fue el elemento que fue considerado para tener una sentencia condenatoria, sin embargo, no se repara el da√±o ni representa una reparaci√≥n integral‚Äù, enfatiz√≥. Protecci√≥n a menores Puntualiz√≥ que el pr√≥ximo a√±o la [Red de Mujeres Unidas por BC ](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/ensenada/Red-de-Mujeres-Unidas-por-Baja-California-exige-igualdad-en-la-justicia-20230917-0023.html)pugnar√° para que se proteja a los menores en esta situaci√≥n y se aplique el protocolo de orfandad. Te puede interesar: [Exigen informe sobre los recursos destinados a la violencia de g√©nero](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/ensenada/Exigen-informe-sobre-los-recursos-destinados-a-la-violencia-de-genero-20231105-0019.html) ‚ÄúVamos a seguir impulsando para que todos estos elementos que encontramos en estos instrumentos de an√°lisis que llevamos a cabo durante 2023 sigan siendo atendidos‚Äù, afirm√≥.

author: gqlshare
title: If there‚Äôs a U.S. economic slowdown, will it be a hard or soft landing?
text:
Global stocks took a hit recently amid fears that the U.S. economy was faltering.
A weaker than expected jobs report, with a rising unemployment rate, was enough for some investors to come to their own conclusions about a coming recession ‚Äì even if many economists didn‚Äôt share the same concerns .
Goldman Sachs raised its odds of a recession occurring in the next year from 15 percent to 25 percent. Some economists have theorized that the economy will have a soft landing , or a slowdown that doesn‚Äôt bring about an outright recession, or hard landing.
A complication for economists is that the labor force grew. More Americans entered the job market and looked for work. Those who are on the sidelines and looking for work are officially counted amid the ranks of ‚Äúunemployed‚Äù in federal data, thereby boosting the unemployment rate.
Q: If there‚Äôs a U.S. economic slowdown, will it be a hard or soft landing?
Economists Ray Major, economist
Soft: The recent slowing of the economy evidenced by layoffs, reduction in consumer spending and the correction in the stock market all point to a looming economic correction. The real question is how willing and how quickly the Fed will use monetary policy to correct the economy in order to avoid a hard landing. In the past five years, it has successfully used the tools at their disposal to stave off a recession at any cost and seem to be poised to do it again.
Caroline Freund, UC San Diego School of Global Policy and Strategy
Soft: Although the jobs market has weakened, unemployment remains relatively low and consumer confidence is stable. The Fed is poised to lower interest rates if the inflation rate continues to fall. However, risks remain and a recession could become a self-fulfilling prophecy if we keep fretting about the landing. Uncertainty leads consumers to delay purchases and businesses to hold back on investment and hiring. So, I am staying optimistic and focusing on the bright spots.
Kelly Cunningham, San Diego Institute for Economic Research
Hard: Flattening of the yield curve (the difference between long and short-term interest rates of bonds), after being inverted the previous two years, signals looming recession. Overspending fabricated dollars and escalating debt combine to make the recession even more severe. Rising unemployment and falling equity prices signal greater downturn as well. The Fed lowering interest rates will cause the money supply to further increase and result in even more inflation following already significantly risen consumer prices.
James Hamilton, UC San Diego
Soft: There are certainly plenty of worries, including bad commercial real estate loans, weakness in the Chinese economy, and conflicts in Ukraine and the Middle East that could easily blow up. The election outcome may bring destabilizing new tariffs or taxes. But based on what has happened so far, if we can avoid a major new disruptive shock, I think the most likely outcome is that we‚Äôll see a slowdown without a recession in 2025.
Norm Miller, University of San Diego
Soft: Hard or soft is in the eye of the beholder. The housing/mortgage industry has been in a recession for a few years, but the overall economy has been so gung ho on AI and the promise of higher productivity that the overall GDP stats, next year, should be mildly negative, if at all. Lower interest rates could help some sectors, such as housing and car buying, so let‚Äôs hope the Fed lowers rates in September by 50 basis points.
David Ely, San Diego State University
Soft: The probability of a recession has increased over the past month, but the overall economy remains reasonably healthy. The number of unemployed workers increased in July, but that is in part due to more people entering the labor force. GDP growth over the past eight quarters has been positive. The Federal Reserve is widely expected to lower Interest rates starting in September, which will encourage greater borrowing and spending.
Alan Gin, University of San Diego Soft: With the latest inflation report showing the rate of inflation falling, the Federal Reserve now has the leeway to be aggressive with rate cuts, and I expect them to do so. There probably will be three rate cuts by the end of the year. That will help the housing market and with rising consumer debt. Despite the rise in unemployment, the labor market is not in a downturn, as job growth remains positive, albeit at a slower pace.
Executives Phil Blair, Manpower
Soft: The Federal Reserve has a great job monitoring our inflation rate over the last few years. Short any huge calamity, we have survived wars, storms and fires and the U.S. economy and stock market have continued to hum along.
Gary London, London Moeder Advisors
Soft: The weakening of the key indicators is economic music to my ears. It is the outcome the Feds targeted to produce the soft landing. My sector, real estate, has effectively been in recession. The fact that we are now on the cusp of a cut in the Fed rate will certainly cause a concomitant decrease in long-term mortgage rates, marking the beginning of a resurgence in transaction volume, activating the vital construction market.
Bob Rauch, R.A. Rauch & Associates
Soft: The economy can avert a recession with a few interest-rate drops soon. However, we are facing record debt and deficit spending. We must start running the country like a business, or the next recession will be profound, long and painful. The lockdowns of 2020 put us into a short but deep recession. If we want a deep, prolonged recession later in this decade, we should continue the mismanagement of our economy.
Austin Neudecker, Weave Growth
Soft: While too early to tell, I will vote hopefully that the economy lands softly. Some portion of the recent jobs report is due to new people searching for jobs that were previously considered out of the market. Luckily, the central bank has built space to reduce interest rates. Most economic indicators remain strong and barring large extraneous factors, we should be able to guide the landing.
Chris Van Gorder, Scripps Health
Hard: Not much has changed in the overall economic big picture, but higher interest rates are probably now having their full effect, and we may see slowdowns in parts of the economy. The biggest risk to our economy would be from a shock such as a broader war in the Middle East, a turn in the Ukraine war or other unknown risks. Such shocks have historically had the power to drive slowdowns or outright recessions.
Jamie Moraga, Franklin Revere
Hard: The U.S. economy continues to show mixed signals and increased volatility. While it may experience signs of a soft landing this year, there‚Äôs an increased possibility that we could see a recession in 2025. Global strife and uncertainty, rising cost of living, prolonged inflation, and increasing household debt have spooked investors. While the economy currently remains resilient, higher interest rates and a weakening jobs report contribute to an economy that remains unpredictable.
Not participating this week: Haney Hong, San Diego County Taxpayers Association
Have an idea for an Econometer question? Email me at phillip.molnar@sduniontribune.com . Follow me on Threads: @phillip020

author: Livemint
title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 hits Ukhrul in Manipur | Mint
text:
An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 was reported near the Ukhrul town of Manipur on Friday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) said. According to NCS, the earthquake occurred around 10 pm at a depth of 120 kilometers.
The National Center for Seismology tweeted , "Earthquake of Magnitude:4.6, Occurred on 29-12-2023, 22:01:19 IST, Lat: 25.14 & Long: 96.54, Depth: 120 Km ,Location: 208km E of Ukhrul, Manipur, India."
No casualties have been reported as of yet. Further details are awaited.
Earthquake in Manipur came days after tremors jolted Assam on December 27 . The earthquake had occured at 5:55 am IST (Indian Standard Time) at a depth of 20km. The epicentre of the quake was located at 42km east of Tezpur.
On December 26, a low-intensity earthquake of 3.3 magnitude on the Richter Scale was recorded near Ambikapur in Chhattisgarh's Surguja district on Tuesday, the NCS informed.
On the same day, two earthquakes of mild intensity struck Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir . There were no immediate reports of any damage due to the tremors.
According to the NCS, an earthquake of 4.5 magnitude had occurred at 4.33 am in Ladakh. The depth of the earthquake was five kilometers below the surface of the earth at 34.73 degrees latitude and 77.07 degrees longitude.
Meanwhile, an earthquake of 3.7 magnitude had occurred was recorded at 1.10 am in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. The depth of the quake was five km from the surface at 33.36 degrees latitude and 76.67 degrees longitude, the NCS said.
On December 28, an earthquake of magnitude 6.3 on the Richter Scale jolted Japan's Kuril Islands , the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) said.
Meanwhile, the death toll from the 6.2-magnitude earthquake that jolted northwest China earlier this week has risen to 149 with two people still missing. The quake, the worst in nine years in the region, struck midnight on December 18 at a depth of 10 kilometres.
(With inputs from agencies)

author: TV5MONDE
title: Russie: lancement r√©ussi de la fus√©e Angara-A5 apr√®s deux reports
text:
[Back to top](#skip-link)
Photo diffus√©e par l'agence spatiale russe Roscosmos, le 11 avril 2024, montrant le d√©collage d'une fus√©e Angara-A5 depuis le cosmodrome de Vostochny, dans l'Extr√™me-Orient russe
La troisi√®me tentative fut la bonne: apr√®s deux reports en deux jours, la Russie a finalement r√©ussi jeudi le lancement de sa fus√©e de nouvelle g√©n√©ration Angara-A5 depuis le cosmodrome Vostotchny, dans l'Extr√™me-Orient russe.
Le lancement a lieu √† 9H00 GMT, selon une retransmission en direct sur le site de Roscosmos, l'agence spatiale russe.
Les images montraient la fus√©e propulser dans les airs et s'√©lever dans le ciel.
"La fus√©e a fonctionn√© normalement, l'√©tage sup√©rieur s'est s√©par√© du troisi√®me √©tage de la fus√©e", s'est f√©licit√© dans un communiqu√© l'agence Roscosmos quelques minutes plus tard.
Ce lancement r√©ussi intervient toutefois apr√®s deux reports en deux jours, mardi et mercredi, pour des raisons "techniques", avait expliqu√© Roscosmos, un nouvel accroc pour le programme spatial russe min√© par les difficult√©s.
La fus√©e Angara-A5 est un engin de nouvelle g√©n√©ration d√©velopp√© dans le cadre d'un programme destin√© √† remplacer les vieillissants lanceurs Proton, dont la technologie remonte aux ann√©es 1960.
Ce programme moderne, dont l'id√©e remonte aux ann√©es 1990, a toutefois pris du retard et le calendrier fix√© par les autorit√©s russes au moment du premier essai, d√®s 2014, n'a pas √©t√© respect√©.
Source d'une immense fiert√© √† l'√©poque sovi√©tique, le secteur spatial russe s'est enlis√© depuis la chute de l'URSS √† force de scandales de corruption, de coupes budg√©taires, de retards en s√©rie et de revers embarrassants, comme la perte de la sonde lunaire Luna-25 en ao√ªt 2023.
Le secteur reste limit√© par son manque d'innovation, la plupart de ses syst√®mes reposant sur des technologies sovi√©tiques, g√©n√©ralement fiables mais vieillissantes.
Il doit aussi faire face d√©sormais √† la concurrence renforc√©e de soci√©t√©s priv√©es, comme l'am√©ricaine SpaceX du milliardaire Elon Musk, et de nouvelles puissances spatiales, comme l'Inde.

author: Mirage News
title: Planning For Coombes Road Upgrade Underway | Mirage News
text: Surf Coast Shire Council will be upgrading Coombes Road, Torquay, with planning now underway. Tenders for the works are being advertised by end of July. The road works will make the road safer for all road users, including drivers, pedestrians and cyclists. The works include: - Coombes Road being widened (with sealed shoulders for cyclists) and resurfaced from Surf Coast Highway to Ghazeepore Road. - Intersection upgrade at Coombes Road and Messmate Road, including the installation of a roundabout. "We know many locals are eager for these works to happen. I drive Coombes Road regularly so I know what a difference these works will make," said Cr Adrian Schonfelder "As soon as the contractor is appointed, and the works schedule is known, we'll let residents know the timeframes and any temporary traffic impacts," he said. Go to [surfcoast.vic.gov.au/CoombesRoadUpgrades](http://www.surfcoast.vic.gov.au/CoombesRoadUpgrades) for updates on the road works. /Public Release. This material from the originating organization/author(s) might be of the point-in-time nature, and edited for clarity, style and length. Mirage.News does not take institutional positions or sides, and all views, positions, and conclusions expressed herein are solely those of the author(s).View in full

author: Just the News staff
title: Heavy metal rock star condemns Hamas, supports Israel, after receiving gift from young fan
text:
Heavy metal rock star condemns Hamas, supports Israel, after receiving gift from young fan
"Rape is not resistance. Slaughtering innocents at a music festival that brings together people from all walks of life is not resistance," said Draiman.
David Draiman, the lead singer of the heavy metal group Disturbed, expressed strong support for Israel when a young female fan handed him a bracelet with the words ‚ÄúAm Israeli Chai,‚Äù which translates to ‚Äúthe people of Israel live.‚Äù
This occurred at a concert in Orlando, Florida on February 26, where Draiman
said he could no longer stay silent.
He said he has family in Israel, according to
Fox News, and that he lost friends at the Nova Music Festival, which was hit hard during the massive terrorist attack on Israel by Hamas on October 7. The attack killed about 1,200 people with another 242 taken hostage, half of whom remain as hostages or are already dead.
"I miss people that were slaughtered like animals at the Nova Festival," he said onstage. "Rape is not resistance. Slaughtering innocents at a music festival that brings together people from all walks of life is not resistance."
The band, Disturbed, is one of the most successful rock bands of the 21st century, according
to Billboard.
"I genuinely feel empathy for the Palestinian people despite what everyone on the other side of the equation likes to claim." Draiman added. "There is not a single Jew on this planet that does not celebrate life. We celebrate life. Hamas celebrates death and they need to be eradicated; not the Palestinians, Hamas. We need to save Gaza from Hamas."
In an interview with
Breitbart, Draiman said that he has normally been "very careful to not infuse Disturbed performances with any kind of political rhetoric," but rather "tries to make concerts an escape from that." He added that the gift from the young fan "seemed like a sign."
"I couldn‚Äôt not acknowledge her very precise, thoughtful gift without being insulting at that point, so I felt compelled to speak about it and I just went completely off the cuff, speaking from my heart and trying to address the elephant in the room, so to speak," he told the outlet. "I just did the best that I could, and I‚Äôm glad that it resonated with as many people as it has apparently so far. Who knows? I can only hope that it has a continuing positive effect."

author: Patrick Iannarelli
title: √à una notte da sogno! L'Atalanta ribalta lo Sporting e vola ai quarti: a Bergamo finisce 2-1 - TUTTO mercato WEB
text: √à una notte da sogno! L'Atalanta ribalta lo Sporting e vola ai quarti: a Bergamo finisce 2-1 Per Bergamo, con Bergamo. Lo aveva detto Gasperini alla vigilia: Sporting battuto e promessa mantenuta. L'Atalanta √® ai quarti di finale grazie al 2-1 arrivato nella ripresa: prima Lookman e poi Scamacca hanno regalato una notte da sogno a tutta la citt√†, un successo fondamentale per continuare la corsa in Europa. Alla fine saltano tutti, anche il Gasp: la Dea √® ancora una volta nelle migliori otto dell'Europa League. L'Atalanta gioca, lo Sporting segna Alla fine l'Atalanta ha deciso di seguire la tattica proposta da Gianluca Scamacca, mettere lo Sporting spalle al muro partendo subito forte. Il numero 90 ha avuto una buona occasione dopo tre giri d'orologio, il tiro masticato √® stato per√≤ intercettato senza troppi problemi da Israel. Interessante la lotta corpo a corpo tra Hien e Gyokeres, lo spauracchio maggiore visti i 33 gol in 37 partite giocate. I nerazzurri ci hanno riprovato al 13' con l'inserimento di Kolasinac, il bosniaco ha recuperato palla a centrocampo per poi chiudere l'azione, il colpo di testa per√≤ √® terminato di poco sul fondo. I padroni di casa hanno provato a sfondare sia sulle corsie esterne che per vie centrali, ma a passare in vantaggio √® stato lo Sporting con un'azione manovrata: Gyokeres ha mandato in porta Pedro Gon√ßalves - Ederson ha lasciato troppo spazio - per il portoghese √® stato semplicissimo superare Musso. Timida la risposta di Holm, il tiro dal limite √® stato bloccato senza problemi dall'estremo difensore dei biancoverdi. I nerazzurri nel secondo tempo hanno fatto l'unica cosa concepita, attaccare lo Sporting sin dal calcio d'inizio. Detto-fatto, la banda del Gasp ci ha messo 39 secondi per trovare il gol del pareggio con Lookman, fino a quel momento totalmente fuori dalla partita. La giocata del nigeriano ha ribaltato l'inerzia, da quel momento la Dea ha alzato i ritmi sorprendendo ancora una volta i lusitani sulla corsia destra, Miranchuk ha aperto il piattone per Scamacca, il numero 90 questa volta non ha sbagliato: 2-1 e sorpasso concluso. Lo Sporting ci ha provato due volte nel finale: Musso ha cancellato il pallonetto a Paulinho, Trincao invece ha spedito in curva. A far festa √® l'Atalanta, ai quarti di finale d'Europa League.
